answers.answer: I havent been yet but if i dont go into natural labour in the next 11 days i will be induced! Ill be 41+5..eugh :\
I was 42 weeks with my first when they induced me I'm hopeing that won't happen again the contractions were a lot harder with the pitocin.
I was 39 weeks when i got induced.
I was 41 weeks 1 day when I got induced. But it was due to preeclampsia
Im soo anxious i am 32 weeks i dont think i want to be induced
I'm exactly 41weeks today & i will get induce tonight

I was induced on my due date with my first and labor was 27 hours and pushing was 15 mins.. doctor asked if I wanted my water broken and of course at the end you just want that baby out of you but looking back all the intense pain I went through, contractions back to back and all they had to do to help dialate it wasn't worth it. Waiting when baby is ready is best bet.. I am 37 weeks now with my little one and this time I will deaf wait things out
I'm getting induced at 39 weeks due to complications...
I heard that it makes the contractions worse, is that true?

i was 42 + a few days when i was induced...does getting induced hurt??No being induced is just the medical intervention to start labor when that naturally doesn't happen usually using an IV to give Pitocin which is a drug that is supposed to stimulate the uterus to contract..This drug does however make contraction more intense but that does not mean that happens to everyone that is just the over view of what its supposed to be like... im my situation i was induced because my body wouldn't go into labor on its own and i was medically getting to far along that it could of caused complications with the baby..  i was first given a Pitocin bulb which is a dissolvable capsule they put on your cervix with Pitocin in it which is supposed to help stimulate your cervix to start labor.. then i was given and IV with Pitocin which caused contractions...because my body reacted so badly to labor i asked for an epidural to force relaxation and allow the natural process to be able to take place...once i was finally relaxed i had VERY short active labor and pushed for 10 mins and had my daughter....i have chosen to go as long as medically possible with this one as well , before being induced. Depending on the doctor they will only induce or C-section when they absolutely HAVE to but like i said that's a doctor to doctor basis...just breath and take one step at a time..being induced is not a scary process just make sure if you are scared to ask questions till you feel comfortable with whats being done :)

question: How many of u ladies got induced and how far along were you when your doctor asked if you wanted to.
title: induction?
